cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest toward the southern North Carolina coast, then forecast to slow and drift west-southwest across eastern South Carolina before curling inland toward the southern Appalachian region.

weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire North Carolina coast, South Carolina coast north of South Santee River, and southeastern Virginia including lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Yes (2–4 ft surge forecast for NC/VA border region and lower Chesapeake Bay)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Friday into Saturday; low (≈2%) chance of sustained 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground level possible along the lower Chesapeake Bay and Atlantic side of Hampton Roads if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rainfall possible across southeastern Virginia with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged high water may restrict vessel movement in the harbor.
